VLIB Function Reference

Good Features to Track

Introduction and Use Cases

A feature detector algorithm like Harris Corner Score may "detect" far more features than what is feasible or desired to track. Since the score of the features are labelled, a post-processing step of ranking and extracting the top subset of features is often needed.

Specification

Function

This algorithm accepts an image array which contains scores of feature candidates, and produces an 8-bit binary mask (0 or 255) of the image based on a programmable quality threshold and number of desired features.

Inputs


    Parameter              Description
    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    im                     16-bit input image                                  (UQ16.0)
    out                    8-bit binary output image (0 or 255)                (UQ8.0)
    width                  Width of the input image                            (SQ31.0)
    height                 Height of the input image                           (SQ31.0)
    thresh                 NONMAX-SUPR Threshold for pruning peaks             (SQ15.0)
    patch                  NONMAX-SUPR Filter width                            (UQ8.0)
    qualitypar             Quality threshold to keep stronger points           (UQ8.0)
    topNfeatures           Number of strongest ranking points to retain        (SQ15.0)
    mindist                Min. distance between two points(spatial diversity) (UQ8.0)
    outTemp                Auxiliary buffer for intermediate operations        (UQ16.0)
   *good_points_number     Number of points resulting                          (SQ31.0)
    pixIndex               NONMAX-SUPR Pixel index buffer                      (SQ15.0)
    internalBuf            NONMAX-SUPR Internal buffer                         (UQ16.0)
    ind                    Index buffer                                        (SQ31.0)

Method

This function first performs non-maximal suppression on the image using the programmable threshold (thresh) and filter width parameters (patch). It then sorts the results by ranking scores. If the number of results are greater than the number of requested features (topNfeatures), then the results are further sorted and extracted based on spatial diversity using the mindist parameter.

APIS
